January was a strange month -- but then, it is every year.  I don't know what it is about January that makes it feel about a thousand years long.  Objectively it's been, what, six weeks since New Year's?  If that?  But it feels as though months have gone by since then.  Maybe it's that from around Thanksgiving until New Year's it's a non-stop string of social obligations, family functions, holidays, shopping, and to-do lists; the office is half-empty on any given day and everyone's too busy making it through the holidays to really have time for anything else.  January's another beast entirely.  It's back to normal, back to the day-to-day routine of full work-weeks and bills, and the knowledge that the cold isn't really going anywhere anytime soon.

February's kicking off all right so far, though I'm ready in a serious way for spring. I've got my roommate's birthday this week, then Lotus at the 9:30 Club Friday and Saturday, which I'm hella excited for.  I'm actually going to get a decent tax return for the first time in three years, and I'm going to use part of that money when it comes in later in the month to buy a tent.  A fucking tent, which is something that I had never really happened to think of owning, but I'm going to get one.  There really is a first time for everything, including my going camping later this summer.  True, it's festival camping, so it's a kind of different beast that regular camping, but still.  Me in a tent for a couple days.  How weird is that?
Oh, Olympics.  I can't stop watching you.  I love you so.

My dear sweet and fluffy lord. I'm so terribly over this damn transcription project, and I've still got another half-hour to go after this. At which point I'll be using my "down time" at work to start looking for a new job. There's -- no possible way for this to be anything other than dead end. There's no room to advance, and I mean that literally. There are four positions on this contract that they're taken. So, there's nowhere to go from here, and I don't like what I'm doing, so that's stupid and I'm over it. On a side note, I can't wait to see the Sherlock Holmes movie. I know, I know -- it may or may not be a thing of madness from which we'll never recover as a people, or it may be so shiny that I'm blinded by its glory, who's to say. But it's shiny from here so it's at least got that going for it, and I need to check it out for myself. Okay. Back to the transcription. Oh, be still my beating heart.

This year's NaNo attempt is really starting to finalize up as an idea in my mind (about time, since, you know, it's NEARLY NOVEMBER AND ALL).  This year I won't be going out of town directly after the start of it, so that's a good thing, right there.  Being in San Francisco for my Wondertwin's birthday last year was awesome, but at the same time missing six days at the beginning kind of made it impossible to get back into the swing of it, for me.

Here's hoping this year will the be year I actually, finally get my act together and finish this thing.  I'm thinking that, once I get my laptop back from the laptop doctor (it got drunk and decided not to work anymore -- no, really.  My laptop had a little too much red wine to drink and took an extended nap) I might go to one of the meet-ups here in DC.  I've never done that before, and I'm thinking it could be fun.
So -- question.  In the Made for TV movie of this political season, who's going to play the part of Joe the Plumber?

MEME:

* Grab the nearest book.
* Open the book to page 56.
* Find the fifth sentence.
* Post the text of the sentence in your journal along with these instructions.
* Don't dig for your favorite book, the cool book, or the intellectual one: pick the CLOSEST.

Boethius, Consolation of Philosophy:

"They dig the earth in search of the good which soar above the star-filled heavens."

OH MY GOD!!!11!!!1elventy-fucking-one!!!1!!1!!!1!

I saw NKOTB last night in concert with my ladies.  IT WAS AMAZING.  I did not expect it, in any way shape or form, to be as FUCKING AWESOME as it was.  HOLY BALLS, it was the BEST THING EVER.

And yes, I don't care how skeevy or sleazy or newly divorced and desperate Donnie Walhberg is, I would still fucking hit that like the fist of an angry, smiting god.

It was -- it was everything my eight year old self who loved them more than breath could have dreamed.

Working from my couch today.  I've got my leg up on some pillows and and going to hunt down some ice to put on it again.  I fell leaving my office yesterday.  It was pretty special.  I stepped wrong and my left ankle buckled and twisted (but is overall fine, just a little sore today) and then fell the last four steps on my right leg, which is swollen not on the ankle, but above it, where I banged hell out of it on the steps on the way down.  It was bad last night, but not as bad today so hopefully it's not going to be too bad a problem.

So I'm sitting here, Danika's on her laptop looking up stuff, and we're randomly watching CMT.  Because, dammit, they actually play *videos* still.

So, I'll be here, and am intending to finish my fic and then maybe nap later.  My email's empty on this, the first day of the government fiscal year, so I don't really have much to do.  

Love to the flist

MEME TIME! 1) Do you have a sport you think of as "yours", either to watch or play? 2) Do you wear glasses/contacts? If so, how long have you worn them? 3) What TV show are you most excited about this year? 4) What is your preferred roadtrip food? 5) Do you have many (any) plants in your home or office? My Answers: 1) My sports are soccer, college basketball, and horseback riding. Horseback riding to do (I rode fairly comptetively for some time). 2) Contacts. I got glasses in Fifth grade, same month I got braces, and I've been wearing contact since freshman year of hogh school. My vision's terrible, in the driving is a bad idea with them kind of way, but in the if I shove things close enough to my face I can see what they are. 3) Supernatural (um, let's go with a big fat "duh" on that one) and Heroes, mostly. I'm behind on a lot of other shows, as I've only been really watching them on Netflix. 4) Utz ridged sour cream and onion potato chips. Only the ruffled kind will really do. Other than that, I'm a big fan of the road-trip cigarette. I smoked way, way too much driving back from California. 5) I've got a fake plastic plant in my office that my friend Gus moved from his to mine when he moved to San Francisco. I don't trust myself with real plants.

We're having a pretty lazy day thus far.  Went grocery shopping earlier, got a bunch of stuff while listening to <lj user="ladykerradine">'s Super Awesome Supernatural mix.  I'm making pasta sauce from scratch, and I made a berry trifle that's chilling in the fridge.  Roommate's doing her nails, while we're both sort of glued to our laptops on the couch as we got our internet and cable installed yesterday.  

We're contemplating going out later, sort of poking at people to see what they're doing versus whether or not we can get there from the metro, so we can do some home-drinking and save some money on going out.  

Or we may just sort of hole up with our cable and internet.  *grins*

I may or may not be working on a Castiel/Dean story.  I may or may not have spent a lot of time reading Misha Collins interviews this afternoon.  I will neither confirm nor deny that I'm all about the hot new angel.

Off to stir my sauce.

Love to the flist!

Okay, fine.  

I fucking love me some Castiel.  Without being spoilery, I love Castiel, I love the idea of the character, I love what he represents, I love where it looks like they're going to go, and it's awesome.  I love the actor in this role, he's got a great delivery and he's smoking damn hot.  He and Jensen have great on-screem chemistry so far (yes, yes, so far -- hush, I know) and it makes me happy in all my places.  I am on fucking board, Kripke -- now don't you fuck this up.

Love to the flist.

*whines*

I don't WANT to have a conference call! Dammit, here we go.

Last night the roommate and I wound up stuck on our couch watching Celtic Thunder or public television for two hours.  There was some good singing, and some hottie Irish singers.  Most enjoyable.  We were both reading while watching, so I managed to get some homework done during the not-as-hot or far-too-young singers were performing and I only had to listen.

After the roommate decided that it was time for some yoga, which I've never really done much of.  So we dragged the coffee table out of the way, scraped up the half-a-cat of hair that Rikah's been rubbing into the carpet (our vacuum thingy is getting picked up from the store tonight) and proceeded to yoga it up for a while, using boxes of kitty litter as "blocks" to help our non-flexible selves do the poses.

The best?  Watching Rascal the cat freak out and keep trying to bother the roommate while she was attempting to fold herself into the poses on the floor.  Nothing like a cat trying to surf your back to make yoga a relaxing experience.

Today:  mostly boring thus far, with a chance of "meh".  Worried about a lot of things, which you will find under the cut.

<lj-cut text="Why Gillian is Stressed Right Now"> 

So, my job is still the one that I had last winter, sadly.  I work for a contracting company that contracts with a branch of the Health and Human Services department, and we do the travel, reimbursement, and such for all the consultants that go on the site visits for this division.

Now, my problem is many-fold.  One, my job is desperately boring.  Like, soul-suckingly boring.  And it's not only boring, but we're underpaid for the boring work that we do, when compared to what comparable positions do at other companies.  So, I'm bored, and underpaid. Our contract is up for renewal, and I'm not sure that we're going to get the contract again.  So I'm stressed that I need to start looking for a new job, because I don't trust my company to keep me on to work on another contract.  We're in a different office in the building than the rest of the company at our location.  I don't even know who's down there, let alone what it is that they do.  And they sure as hell don't know me, so I doubt strongly that they're going to take the time to care about keeping me aboard and on another project if we don't get this contract again.

The other side to this problem, is that my friend's mom is my supervisor.  I got this job through said friend, who worked here before me.  I took over for a different friend of mine, and a third friend also works here.  She's itching to get out the door for a different opportunity, as is the other logistics co-ordinator.  We have a four person office, and two of the four are trying to get out as soon as possible and it looks like one will.  My boss, I shall call her E, is a sweet, awesome lady.  However, she's very much the "mom" type of manager, which is fair in that she's the mom of one of my friends, but not cool in that you can't manage like a mom.  She's very much so a micromanager, which I don't like in a boss, and has only been the project director since last fall, when the old one was fired for nefarious actions and defrauding the company out of money.  So she never expected to be the supervisor, and still seems unsure of herself in a lot of ways in regards to the managing of employees.

This contract lasts through mid February.  We were supposed to get the RFP at the end of August to work up the proposal for the next contract, but we don't have it yet.  We have a conference call with the fed person tomorrow, and I'm worried about what she's going to say.  And even if we get the contract, I still don't like my job and still would want to look for a new one.  And I'm scared about having only six weeks in order to find another job in this economy, especially with my special circumstances.

On to these circumstances:  I just started grad school this semester.  I'm only taking one class now, but next semester I need to take two.  In part so that I don't wind up taking like six years to get my masters (as I have tentative plans that if the Masters of Liberal Arts goes well I'd like to go and do a full-time masters in English with an eye towards a PhD program and would really like to be started on that before I'm 30) and in part because I need to be at six credits to qualify for financial aid, I need to be at two classes.  My college is about an hour from where I live and work, but their classes during the semester are in the evenings for the most part.  

Here's the rub:  some classes are at 4:50, some are at 7:30.  If I could get two 7:30 classes, I don't have to worry about leaving work early to get to class.  If I can get one of each, it won't be as big a deal, provided I can manage to convince my boss of wherever I'm at that it's okay for me to leave one day a week early.  If they're both at 4:50, I'm probably fucked -- unless I'm at this job, where my boss is like "It's school, that's fine, we have flexible hours, you can just come in earlier and make up the time on other days".

So, in order for me to leave this job that I don't like, I have to find another one that's willing to potentially let me leave at 3:00 o'clock twice a week to go to school.  And I'm really scared about trying to look for that.  So that's a reason to stay.  But I hate this job and am really, really bored and not even sure that this job will be here in February.

ARG.  I need to have a serious sit-down with myself and figure this all out, but it's cranky and I want to avoid thinking about it as long as possible.  But, that will lead to other problems, so I need to deal with it now, I do believe.

Why does everything have to be complicated?  Can't I just drive around the country  (which I want to do, anyway) in my car and shoot stuff?  Can I Mary Sue myself into the backseat of the Impala, please?

To the small kitten currently running around my apartment:

I know you're cute.  I know you can be very, very cuddly and like to sprawl across my back with your little kitty paws hanging off the sides and your little kitty face purring into my hair.  It's almost unspeakable adorable.

However, you also like to jump on things when unsupervised and I nearly lost my favourite perfume to you the other day.  This is why you're not allowed in my bedroom unsupervised.  

My going to sleep means that I will not be able to supervise your journeys around my bedroom.

So please stop batting under the door with your tiny, cute kitty paw and meowing to be let in.

Go bother your mommy -- the roommate's door is open and I'm sure she'd be more than happy to wake up with your cute kitty face next to her.

The power of your cuteness shall not move me!

So, Season Four? So far, I'm MAD down. Like, MAD DOWN. We'll see if Kripke can keep it up, or if we're going to have words. In Sunday the roommate and roommate 2.5 (Herein after references at RM2.5), Mary and I watched a couple of episodes, and as it was bitch-ass hot in my non air-conditioned apartment, we decreed it pantless supernatural time. Last night, RM2.5 got so excited when The Road So Far started rolling on she dropped her pants in joy. We've named our apartment Candy Mountain. Yes, as in that Candy Mountain. It's Friday, and the day needs to finish. It's so close to being done. Why won't the work-day just end so I can get on having a weekend? I'm going home after work to do laundry, and I'm thinking of borrowing the roommate's ipod and roaming the streets for a bit. Now that I don't have to feel weird being like "going for a walk, family!" about the whole trying to excercise thing, I'm going to try to make it a more regular occurance. I just wish that Ipod hadn't died (*mumbles* two years ago now) so that I could rock my own music. Soon, soon. Love to the flist.
When you see this, post another Supernatural quote in your LJ. Let's see how long this can go on. Dean: Sam . . . . SAMMY! (Countless episodes, whenever Sam gets himself into trouble.

<lj-cut text="Still Here, Coming Back">

This is me, emerging from several months of quiet.  My lj activity is closely linked to a few different situational factors, I've realized.  The major ones being: access to internet and level of comfort with myself.

There a few reasons that I write fanfic, and that I RP.  The main one is for fun -- working out a story or a scene that I like, getting it down or getting it played out, is fun and appeals to multiple parts of my nature, regarding creativity, story-telling, performing, etc.  

But the other reason that I write fanfic, is that sometimes when my mood swings down the best way to handle it is to separate it from myself, to strive to squash it down and to remove it from my being.  It's like isolating a virus before it can spread -- sometimes to better results than others.

And when this is the case, the best way to get it out of me when I can't get it out of *me* is through a fic.  Through expressing my emotions in the experience of a character, trying to mesh the -- the overall feeling of my mood through the filter of a character's mindset -- and while the cirucmstances are different in what I write from those going on in my life, and the reasons for the emotions that the character is experience in no way reflect my experiences, the resulting outpouring of emotions can go through my fingers and out, and I can unsually get them gone, and go on with my regularly scheduled life -- or, I can sort of know that it's time to batten down the hatches and go to serious work on myself pulling back to level.

(Being an unmedicated manic depressive requries a lot of internal upkeep, and is something I'm still learning how to manage as best I can until I get up the courage to go back to dealing with the medical profession -- anyway, that's a whole other long, long story).

This was something that I never really thought that I did, until I realized that there's a certain kind of fic that I write when I'm lonely, or when I'm working on maintaining my mood and staving off depression, then when I'm writing for the joy of the act of writing.  And there's certain kinds of fic that I read that produce the same affect.  And generally, I'm all Yay, Catharsis!  Rock on!

But sometimes that purposeful crossing of idea of self with character hurts, because every now and again when I get pulled into that mood I can't get out of it, because it's not just a little slip but a big one -- and what was previously an excercise in a little self-administered therapy becomes a mental trap where the mood/emotions/etc won't let go, but instead whirlpools around together and sticks -- this is when I find myself identifying *too* closely with the characters that I'm reading or writing about, abd then I need to pull myself back, and to make sure that I can find that seperation between my own emotions and my characters' emotions -- because that knife cuts both ways, and there have been times when I'm screaming at myself to stop being upset simply because a fictional character is angsting in a story.

I do this with original characters, as well, when I'm cycling through moods.  My moods have been fairly stable for the past few years, barring the standard reactions to major life events.  As such, I've been able to enjoy my fannish nature in a way that was just that -- enjoyment, not need.

This summer was rough for a lot of reasons, and I found myself drifting back to that place again, where I was over-identifying with characters, and taking their emotions -- most speficially their pain -- into myself through some freakish fannish mind-vampirism.  I recognize that it's special, that it's not actually real emotion that I was pulling into myself, but it hurts the same -- and it echoed and amplified the pain that I was already feeling at the time.

If I disappear, I will be back -- as I am now -- when I'm feeling like I can firmly understand the line between my own shit and that of fictional characters who have no emotional shit excpet that which others have chosen to create for them.  It's a tool, but it turns in my hand sometimes when I'm not doing well, and becomes a hinderance.

Hopefully I don't sound too crazy now, and have at least a bit explained why I've been hopping in and out of not just fandom, but the greater LJ for the last while.  I miss it, and am happy to be gearing up for a new season of Supernatural and all the goodies that's going to come along with it.  It's been a long hiatus, but I got my roommate and roommaye 2.5 (she spends the majority of her time at the apartment but doesn't technically live there) into the show over the summer, and they're ready to go, and my SPNBFF and I are prepped and ready.  Heroes rolls around Monday, and god help me but I'll be back from class in time to watch that.  And I can't wait to watch the internet react to these things.

As always, love to the flist.

<>When you see this, post another Supernatural quote in your lj. Let's see how long this can go on for. Dean: You know what, there's a ton of lore on unicorns, too. In fact, I hear that they ride on silver moonbeams, and that they shoot rainbows out of their ass!

I pulled this from first, although others have it up, too You know how sometimes people on your friend's list post about stuff going on in their life, and all of a sudden you think "Wait a minute? Since when are they working THERE? Since when are they dating HIM/HER? since when???" And then you wonder how you could have missed all that seemingly pretty standard information, but somehow you feel too ashamed to ask for clarification because it seems like info you *should* already know? It happens to all of us sometimes. Please copy my response below, erase my answers putting yours in their place then post it in your journal! Please elaborate on the questions that would benefit from elaboration! One-word answers seldom help anyone out. 1. First Name: Gillian 2. Age: 26 3. Location: Montgomery County, Maryland again. Will hopefully soon be in the same county, but different city. 4. Occupation: I'm a "logistics coordinator", technically -- by a month -- the senior one on our contract. I work for a consulting company, and the contract that I'm on is with a department of the federal government, and we work to travel consultants along with federal teams to review grantees that get federal money to provide a vareity of health care services. 5. Partner: Partnerless at the moment, and have been for a while. I made a vow that I'm not dating until I move out of my parents' house. 6. Kids: I'm kidless. I refer to my "hypothetical future children" from time to time, in that I would like to have kids some day, but that day feels like it's pretty far in the future. 7. Brothers/Sisters: I have one sister, who's getting ready to turn 20 in just under a month. We've been consistently getting closer as we've been getting older and the age difference doesn't feel so large. We're very, very different people, but manage to agree on movies if not anything else in pop culture. I love her to death and I couldn't be prouder of how awesome a chica she's turning out to be. 8. Pets: technically none of my own, but I live with the lumbering love bundle of a pug named Hamlet (or Hammie, or Ham-Ham, or Omlette), and he's the cutest thing ever. 9. List the 3-5 biggest things going on in your life: a) The first is the concern over what I'm going to do about my living situation. When I came back East last fall after just over a year in California I came back twenty-five year old, broke, unemployed, and incredibly lonely. My company had closed down that spring, and as I had just started to break even after the move when that happened I had no money in savings to hold me through the job search. I worked some crap part time jobs and went on interviews for months, ran up a lot of debt on my credit cards trying to multitask -- you know, put gas in the car and buy groceries and cigarettes and pay the posh fees in fancy parking garages to go on interviews all at the same time -- and while I learned a lot about myself, it was a hard time. Now, nearly a year later, I'm still living at home with my parents and trying to find a damn place to live. I've paid off the debt from being unemployed in LA, and I'm starting to save money again, but now the Future Roomate and I are freaking because everywhere we're looking is so expensive. We're willing to go a fair bit in the "sketchy - affordable" spectrum to find a reasonable place, but it's so hard to find one in this damn county. b) My other big thing is my job. I like who I work with and where I physically am working, and a lot about the stuff around what I do (flexible hours, work from home capabilities) but I don't actually like what I do. And now, it looks like our contract might not (read: I find a snowball in hell to be the better odds for my money right now) get renewed. I don't trust my company to put me on another contract if that's the case, and so I'm trying to figure out the options. If the RFP is due in October, and the extension will run through February, when do I start looking for another job so I don't wind up unemployed after having just moved into an apartment I will then be unable to afford? My back's so fucked up I can't even imagine waitressing again, and I'm already scared running down budgets with what I'm making now that I can't bear the thought of having to scrape by under the poverty line again. So, my job is freaking me the hell out. c) I've started taking piano lessons again. GOOD THING!! NOT WORRISOME!!! I studied the piano seriously from when I was six (as serious as any six year old can do anything) until just after I graduated high school. It's been seven years since I last took lessons, and just about three weeks ago now I was dicking around with that etude that Alec plays in Dark Angel. I decided that, god dammit, if he could do it, I could -- and I got about two pages into it, got to the big old hard, fast, and dirty section, and looked at my fingers and yelled "I need an adult!". I had my first lesson yesterday morning before work, and it went really well. I'm so excited to be getting back into that part of my life -- something that I enjoyed doing back before the whole fiasco that was a good chunk of college, something that I loved that I was good at and felt confident in myself by doing. I missed the music, I missed that feeling you get when you have the notes in your fingers solidly enough that you're not thinking "oh crap -- A flat c--e--a flat, of crap --" but instead your thinking "accent, hit the melody, okay" and then you're just not thinking, but instead acutally feeling the music. Dork, yes, I'm a classical piano dork, but I had forgotten how much I loved it, and how good it feels just to be playing music. d) I'm tip-toeing towards a decision about what to do with my novel. Whether to start over now that I've made so many changes to the world, or to try to fix what I have. What to change and put down in this next draft, who to pull in earlier, all of that. How to bring the world across to people when they read it, how to really tell the story. It's coming, I'm nearly there -- I'm just, well, I guess you really could say that I'm working up the courage to go into it again, to finally committ fully and wholly to the project. It's coming, and it's coming soon. 10. Where and for what did you go to school?: I went to the University of Maryland, College Park (GO TERPS!) and I studied English Literature. I was going to have a mythology focus, but, well, I was lacking a mythology class and they weren't fucking teaching any that I needed, so I wound up with my concentration in "British Post Colonial and Anglophone Literature". Yup. I started out as a History major, by the by, and then I was briefly a theater major before I said "fuck it, I like books and I like to write, I'll be over here having a cigarette and yelling about Fitzgerald, sleeping in late since all the best classes don't start until after noon, anyway". 11. Parents: I have a really good relationship with my parents. We've had some issues in the past, but as I've gotten older it's gotten easier. Part of it is that they're a good deal older than me and my sister -- My mother was 39 and my father was 36 when they adopted me, and 45 and 42 when the adopted Gabbie. It's a bit of a gap, but it's gotten easier. It is better when I'm not living at home, and that's another part of why I can't wait to move. But I'm lucky in that my parents and I are close. 12. Who are some of your closest friends?: I have a couple of different little tribes of friends. I have my Borg, my ladies whom I love and adore. I can't imagine now how it actually was before I knew them. I met them my junior year of college. I have a large gaggle of people that I've known for years and years that I see a lot. It's a mix of people that I've known since my freshman year of high school and people that we sort of absorbed along the way, swallowing them into the tribe. It's got a bit of a rotating cast, of which I sometimes am a part, but it's a good group of people who I can't imagine not knowing until I'm super old. And I have my Future Roomate and the Dankia, whom I've been spending a lot more time with since I've been back. Love to the flist!

You are in a mall when the zombies attack. You have: 1. one weapon. 2. one song blasting on the speakers. 3. one famous person to fight alongside you. * Weapon can be real or fictional; you may assume endless ammo if applicable. Person can be real or fictional. 1) AK-47 with a scope -- gotta get that headshot, don't you know 2) Man, this one's hard. There are so many great songs to kill zombies too, you know? Hm. You know what? I'm going to do a top 4 list of zombie killing songs, and cheat the meme. 1) Daft Punk -- "Steam Machine" 2) NIN -- "Survivalism" 3) That goth-industrial version of the Lord's Prayer in Latin that's FANTASTIC 4) Hardcore Muthafucka -- the Humptyvission / Voxx mix 3) Alice from Resident Evil -- because she is both hot and has proved herself to be good at killing zombies.

Well.

It's 5:00 in the morning.  After drinking copious amounts of Rum, swimming in the Atlantic Ocean several times in my underwear, and accidentally bumming bear off of high school kids off at four am at their bonfire, one outdoor shower down, I'm in my bunk with my laptop about to go to sleep.  I made it up hear with my beach towel, since I can't find my pajamas and have given up the host of sleeping in clothing.  

Drunk ass poster is DRUNK.

Love to the flist!

I'm sitting in our beach house in Hatteras, down in the Outer Banks.  The house is amazing.  It's four levels, the first up off the ground.  The ground level's got a parking area and some outdoor showers, and the first floor is maintenance stuff and stuff for the owners.  The second floor is my room, which I'm sharing with some people, and a few other bedrooms, bathrooms, and the laundry room.  The third floor is open and huge, with living room, sitting area, kitchen and dining area.  There are balconies around all the levels, and the third has the hot tub.  The fourth floor is the game room.  We have a view of the beach, although we're across the street from it, and of the sound from the balcony.

Spent most of the day today on the beach, and we're getting ready to go and do a second run to the grocery store.  Ashley and I brought down all the food that we'd bought on Friday, and the liquor, and we're going to go get produce and bread and stuff like that.

Worked on the fic last night, showed Danika some youtube videos -- the gag reels and such -- and I think we've got another fan girl on our hands now.  *grins*  I'm an enabler.

Long weekend, mostly good. Went and played softball with Kyle and Bryna on Sunday. It was on and off a little rainy, which was less than ideal but not the worst thing. The league that they play in is based in DC, and they play on the fields in West Potomac Park by the tidal basin, so I was playing softball with a view of the monuments, which was neat. Parking was, as expected, a bitch, and for the first time in memory Googlemaps let me down on directions, but that's okay. Kyle got hit in the face with the softball and split the inside of his mouth open on his tooth, and we lost by an astounding number of runs, but it was fun. Saturday I went with my family to my mom's friend's yard sale, and I got a rack ton of pots and pans and pot-and-pan lids for thirty dollars, which was awesome. Saturday afternoon was the Future Roommate's graduation party with her family, of which she has a LOT. The family that I hadn't met before was nice, and I like them all, so that's cool. I picked up some new sheets from target on the way home (as I'm going to have a full-size bed instead of a twin day bed, which is super exciting) and stayed in Satuday night. I'm super sore today, and my knee reminded me that it's been quite a while since we were up to any sort of running, but I think I'm going to go and play with them again. I'm going down to the Outer Banks over memorial day weekend, which should be awesome. I'm taking Friday off to go and talk to the leasing agent people in the apartment that Ashley and I like, and then we're going to load up on enough food and booze to keep sixteen people satisfied for a week (at Costco and Valhalla, respectively). Saturday we're leaving for North Carolina at 7:00 am from Ashley's house, and I'm coming back Wednesday afternoon. I'm about three quarters of the way though the last chapter of Come a Horseman -- if people would just stop popping in from out of town I could get it finished. :) Love to the flist

I have this one thing that I have to do at work that I just don't feel like doing.  I've looked up option after option for this consultant's travel, checking from multiple airports to multiple other airports, and I'm tired of it.  Nothing is making him and the team leader happy, they're not, probably, going to ever be happy with these arrangements, but if you're travelling to the middle of Wisconsin, there aren't that many options that you get to have for your travel.  PICK ONE AND SHUT UP!!  I have a whole lot of other site reviews I need to work on, I really don't care about your pain any more, and between you and the "I am a large man, I have to have an aisle seat" guy today's been kind of crappy.

As a result, I'm avoiding going back to find one othe rset of options, which I shouldn't be doing.  I'm finishing up forms for other consultants' reimbursements, doing initial contact emails, that sort of thing.  I just don't feel like dealing with this one thing, and so I'm kind of . . . not at the moment.  Probably not the best work ethic, but to hell with it.  Until five o'clock -- then I'll do it.  From 5 - 6 I'll deal with the hot mess that is that review.

In more fun news, poker tonight and then yard sale for house goodies on the morrow.  

And *hugs* along with the love to the flist.

<lj-cut text="Thoughs on Season Finale">

I was fine, guys.  I was totally fine -- sad, and a little freaked out about the picturing of hell, but okay -- until pretty much right now.

Damn you, Kripke, and damn you too, Arcade Fire.  I was fine until the radio started playing this song:


"No Cars Go"

We know a place where no planes go
We know a place where no ships go

(Hey!) No cars go
(Hey!) No cars go
Where we know

We know a place no space ships go
We know a place where no subs go

Hey, no cars go
Hey, no cars go
Where we know

Hey!
Hey!
Mom, Dad!
No go!

Hey! Us kids know
Hey! No cars go
Where we know

Between the click of the light and the start of the dream.

*wails*

Going out for a cigarette with Sasha, getting over the angst.  

*wails some more, again*

Oh, season finale, don't you let me down!  I'm expecting nothing other than crazy mad angsty goodness, as season finales are prone to have.  Nothing short of glory, Kripke, you magnificent bastard, do you hear me?  GLORY!!

DON'T LET ME DOWN (BRRRRRUCE!)

AGHH!!!!!

/spn nerd mode.

Weekend was good, although very random. Friday I met up with Mary and Mia after work, got dinner and bummed around White Flint, and then I scurried off to see Ironman before running over to the 'Dome. Ironman = AWESOME, by the way. We finished off one of the bottles of Cruzan Black Cherry rum, and I had one of those random chain smoking on the back porch evenings, as it was not raining. Crashed at the 'Dome, then swung by Starbucks on the way home to get coffee and post my fic. Took a nap, went to Target and got a rackton of DVDs on sale (including a combo pack of Dark Angel season one with Dark Shadows season one for twenty bucks) and got some kitchen stuff for The Move. Called my friend Jessica as I sat checking my email in front of Starbucks again, and she was in the same shopping center getting some groceries so we randomly hung out in front of my car for an hour. Future Roommate called as I was on my way home, and she came over and we ran up to Valhalla, actually named "The Wine Corridor". After we walked through there -- she had never seen its glory -- we decided to drive to the beach. We left at 10:30 and got to Ocean City a little before 1:30 in the morning, thanks to some construction or something closing down a lane on the Bay Bridge. We crashed at about 3:00 and got up at 8:30. We had breakfast at the Bayside Skillet, which had an amazingly pink and strawberry themed decor. Even the little curb-gaurd things between the parking spaces where pink with strawberries on them. I got a potato and seafood breakfast, which was ginormous and came back home in a box. You may note my surprise at its size: Ashley got what I in retrospect should have gotten, the Strawberry Crepes. We wandered down to the beach by the end of the boardwalk. It was chilly, grey and mostly deserted. The water was still beautiful, although in a stark way that I rarely see at the beach. We talked to a guy with a cute dog for about an hour, Ashley trying to get BoBo (the dog) to chase her into the edge of the water, but it was mostly nothing doing on his part. We left to come back just after noon, and then it was mother's day dinner. I took a nap after dinner, then watched Survivor with my mom, and then hung out with my sister and her friend Lauren, who had just gotten hom from Penn State. Tonight, the chriropractor, then laundry and fic writing and, dear lord help me, probably Dancing with the Stars while folding said laundry. Nothing exciting, which is good, because I'm still tired. Love to the flist

<lj-cut text="Future Spoiler Thoughts">

Goodnight, sweet Bela.  I find you incredibly hot and a character of much potential had you been placed in rather different storylines than you were.  I shall hug you in my mind and put you in stories where you're awesome and doing awesome things and having lots of the hot, hot sex with Faith.  You'll like it in that world, I promise.  And no one can yell at you and tell you that you sucked (and, you know I love you, honey, but they weren't always wrong) and you can redeem yourself by being awesome there.  You'll see.  Puppies and unicorns and tight black leather and Faith and body oil.

It's your (and my) happy place.  

Go into the light, Bela.

Faith's waiting for you.

</lj-cut>

In other news, STOP RAINING!!  We've had the April showers, it's time for the damn May flowers already.  Stop it now!

My sister's back from college today, all done with two years of that already.  How did that happen?  When did my little sister get to be just two months shy of being twenty years old?  Good god, that's craziness!  She's been kicking ass and taking names in school, and I'm proud that she turned out to be so good at all of that stuff.

Work progresses on the anti-christmas fic, that should be up and going sometime tomorrow.  I like this having a laptop thing again, it's pretty neat, I have to say.  

Ashley and I are looking more into apartments, and it's looking like this place in Germantown could be pretty nice.  It's a bit further out than I might have wanted -- it's fifteen miles from the office -- but it's got what we're looking for and a bit more in our price range.  For 1225 we can get a two-bedroom that's set up with both rooms as master-sized bedrooms with their own baths and big closets and such, which I'm pleased with.  Because trying to divide up who gets the 13 x 11 room and who gets the 9 x 11 room versus dividing up the money accordingly is not a happy process -- and if we can get two 13 x 11's with our own bathrooms for cheaper than other places, I'm down.  It's also close to a slew of stuff -- safeway, giant, petco, fast food and restaurants, a sushi place, a few bars, a movie theater, and just up from a wal-mart, target, and a couple of other things.  So, we'll see.

New Supernatural tonight, whoo! 

Love to the flist.

I've been working on my Anti-Christmas Fic Exchange fic, and am pleased to say that I will actually have the damn thing finished on time. Whoo! That's an excitement. It's about 75% crack with about 22% angst and 3% what I am going to term a happy ending. Good times! Work's progressing -- the fact that it's alread three o'clock is both a good and a bad sign, if you know what I mean. I have my secomd chiropractic appointment today, and I'm trying to figure out what to do about it. If I prepay the fist twelve treatments it'll save me $120, but I can't prepay that right now since I just bought my laptop (right before I started with the chiropractor). So, it's either pay the extra ten bucks per visit, or see if I can hold off on the next visits until after my rebate check comes in and I pay it then. Man, money sucks. Well, okay, let's word that properly -- not having enough money to do all the things that I need to do and still be able to afford the things that I want to do sucks. I think, by the end of summer, I'm not going to really have a view left from my window -- I think it's going to be about 90% tree branches. But in a good way -- the sort of bright green leaves filtering the sunlight kind of way. I'm totally down wiht that, since my blinds are broken and if not for the leaves I'd be blinded in the afternoon. Plus, it's mad pretty.

I can haz a laptop!  WHOOO!

I have my new laptop, it's super shiny and lovely and I'm deliriously happy that I have it.

Oh man, the amount of fic that I have to write now that I had a writing device outside of work hours is astounding.  

And -- and I have my MUSIC!!!  For the first time in months I have my MUSIC!!!!

*joygasm*

That is all.

Okay, everybody, I have a bit of an odd request.

I've kind of fallen into a thing where I now ship Faith from Buffy with Bela from Supernatural.  So, I've decided that, since I ship it, someone else must ship it, and therefore it must be a thing, so I'm starting a community for it.  <lj user="faith_and_bela">.  Super original name, I know.

Does anyone happen to have any icons or banners or art or anything with the two of them together?  Because that would be super awesome and I would love you forever and ever.
Come on, come on, day, IS IT TIME YET??? Impatient fangirl is IMPATIENT!!! By the by, go listen to the song "Daft Punk is Playing at my House" by LCD Soundsystem. It's the bestest.

I would like to point out to everyone that next Tuesday is free-scoop day at Ben and Jerry's.

I would now like to let you know how I just came to find that out.

I work in a small office of four people, and it's amusing in that:

1) My old co-worker Kyle's mother is in charge of the office and our project (and Kyle, in years previous was my roommate for a semester)

2) Our resources manager is a friend of mine from long before work who's awesome

3) The "new hire" (meaning, she's been here a month less than me) gets along with us greatly and we've already gone drinking with her several times

4) I currently have the job that one of my best friends left to move to San Francisco.

All in all, I'm amused at how that's worked out.  But -- the point here is, I just got a call from Bryna, the resources manager, that we are taking a group outing to Free Scoop Day as an office bonding activity.

I may hate the actual work that I do, but man, I love my co-workers.

The day wears ever onward.  I called the place about car donation (Cristiano is going to a nice family who lives in the country), but I don't have the title with me at work so I'm going to have to call them tomorrow.  And then I have to clean him out and have a moment where I talk to him about how he's going to be helping people, and that it's a good thing to do, and that I'll always love him.  And then I'm going to have to take some pictures of him, because I love him.

In other, less maudlin news, I hate <lj user="ladykerradine"> with all my heart and soul, for putting into my head the idea that for a job, Dean had to go undercover as a tent revival style preacher.  Because now it's going on the list of fic that I'm going to write when I get my DAMN TAX RETURN, COME ON NOW! and can finally buy a new motherfucking laptop.

stolen the meme from <lj user="ladykerradine">

Pick a fictional character (that I play or write) from a fandom (or a game, or a fic) and I'll answer the following questions to the best of my abilities: 

1) What is your opinion of this character? If you like, explain why you like him/her. Likewise if you dislike the character.
2) Is he/she important to the general plot?
3) Can you relate to this character at all? Do they grip you emotionally?
4) How much do you like the fandom that this character comes from?
5) Do you ship this character with any other character? Or, are you particularly intrigued by their relationship with any other character(s)? (romance or platonic)
6) Is there anything about the character you would change?
7) If you were in the fandom with this character or knew this character in real life, how do you see yourself interacting with him/her? (Would you get along well? Fall in love with? Dislike? Friendly rivalry? etc etc)
8) Does this character make the cut as one of your all time favourites (if you like) or least favourites?
9) Would you hype up this character (if you like) or warn about (if you dislike) to someone who's new to the fandom?

Oh my god, I bought a new car.  Like, an actual brand new car that had 19 miles on it when I took it for a test drive.

I am now the proud (and vaguely terrified) owner of a 2008 Chevy Cobalt, that no one but me has ever owned.  OH MY GOD.  It's super exciting, but it's also by FAR the most expensive thing that I have ever purchased.  

Now I need a name for the car.  I have to get to know it -- a maddening pronoun, that.  I think that I'm getting a feminine vibe off of this car, but I need to drive it a bit more before I allow it to become a "her".  And then it'll need a name, and oh man, that takes forever.  *grins*  But it's good times.

Oh guys, I just agreed to pay for a new car.  Ack!

While I'm looking through everything that I have written by (and dear god, with the email rps there's a lot, I figured I'd post this myself. Quote a bit of my writing at me? Find that one story of mine that you really like, and find a sentence or a paragraph that presses your prose-buttons in the right way, and comment here with it, no matter how long or short. I'm curious . . .

List seven songs you are into right now. No matter what the genre, whether they have words, or even if they're not any good, but they must be songs you're really enjoying now, shaping your spring. Post these instructions in your LJ along with your 7 songs. Then tag 7 other people to see what they're listening. 1) The Arcade Fire -- "Keep the Car Running" 2) Kaiser Chiefs -- "I predict a Riot" 3) Bloc Party -- "The Prayer" 4) Shiny Toy Guns -- "You are the One" 5) LCD Soundsystem -- "Daft Punk is Playing at my House" 6) Arctic Monkeys -- "I Bet you Look Good on the Dance Floor" 7) The Subways -- "Rock and Roll Queen" Oh man, I can't wait until I get my computer and can get back at all my music. Joy! Some of you may have done this already, and if so, um, nevermind? *grins* TAG: , , , , , ,

Oh man, the car, he is a-dying.  Cristiano the Car wouldn't start again this morning.  I've been slowly coming to the conclusion that I need a new car, but I don't want to loose this one.  Out of the 109,000 + miles on that car, I have personally logged all but about 2500.  That's over 106,000 miles that I have driven that car since the morning after Chamber of Secrets premiered.  I have spent some TIME in that car.  I've driven him across the country twice, once alone, all of my things stuffed in him to the gills.  When I lived in California and was lonely and felt more alone than anyone in the world, I would get in my car and drive around.  My car was literally my best friend in Los Angeles.  I know that car, and I love that car, and if a fucking hunk of car could love anything I'd swear that he loved me.

But it's getting to be time.  I can't really countenance putting much more money into him.  Over the past 18 months he's gotten over 3,000 in repairs, and now he won't start again.  The alignment's off, and I'm driving like I'm doing a leg yeild on a horse.  He's running hot, now that the temperature gauge is working again, and little things are starting to part company with where they should be.

It's time.  

So in addition to the rest of my regularly scheduled life, I'm going to be looking at cars.  I have no idea what kind of car to look for, but my dad's going to help me out with it.  

I got driven in to work today by my dad, like I was being dropped off at school, and my mom is picking me up.  I had to get a friend to agree to pick me up tomorrow from work so I can get home.

I need a new car.

*wipes away single emo-tear*

Oh dear god in bloody heaven please let them stop remodeling the office next door to mine. I don't know who's in that office now or what the fuck they're doing, but it sounds like someone's going to come through the wall with a chainsaw at any minute, or at the very least hack through the wall with a giant mallet all "here's johnny" to come and kill me dead. I've always been very jumpy with noises behind me, and my back is to that wall so I can face the door. It's freaking me the hell out. I'm like eyeing the paper cutter on my table -- can I reach it in time and break free the swinging arm, to give myself a machete against the undead coming through my wall, before they kill me? Because that's what it sounds like next door.
